title: Did You Know? Roop Singh, Legendary Dhyan Chand's Brother, Outscored Him In The 1932 Olympics
text:
Did You Know? Roop Singh, Legendary Dhyan Chand's Brother, Outscored Him In The 1932 Olympics

Did You Know? Roop Singh, Legendary Dhyan Chand's Brother, Outscored Him In The 1932 Olympics

We have known the greatness of Dhyan Chand, and the sorcery he did with the hockey stick - the magnifique sight still gives the pleasure over 70 years later.

AFP

There is no doubting Chand's brilliance, but his brother Roop Singh was no mug with the hockey stick himself. The younger of the two brothers, Roop Singh was a fascinating watch and had a keen eye for goal.

While Dhyan Chand took all the limelight, Roop went about his business away from it - scoring goals and mesmerising much like his brother. Roop Singh astonishingly outscored his brother at the 1932 Los Angeles Olympics.

AFP

In what was his first Olympic Games participation, Roop Singh was in red hot streak as he scored a ridiculous 13 goals in two games. In the final game against USA, he alone scored 10 goals. Yes, a freaking 10!

India won the Olympic gold in 1932 much to heroics of Roop Singh. His brother Dhyan Chand too scored a flurry of goals, ending with 12 in the two games.

Stock

But it was Roop Singh who not only outscored his brother, but introduced himself to the world - not as Dhyan Chand's brother, but as someone who could hold his own, and not be fazed by his already established legendary brother.

In the two games, India scored an astonishing 35 goals, with the brother Roop and Chand scoring 25 of those goals.

It was the younger of the two siblings, Roop Singh, who took ruled the scoring charts.
